Verification from medical mask producer: The expert checked with PriMED, one of the leading medical mask producers, and found that their FAQ page states that "the color always faces out" on a medical mask.
Advice from health protection center: The Center for Health Protection, established in Hong Kong during the SARS outbreak in 2004, advises wearers to wear the colored side on the outside of the mask.
Information from San Francisco Departmen: The San Francisco Department of Public Health's website confirms that "the colored side of the mask is usually the front and should face away from you, while the white side touches your face."
Evaluation of the claim: The expert evaluated the claim made in the Facebook post and found that it was false, as the information provided by medical professionals and health organizations contradicted the claim.
